IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: CONTINUING CARE COMMUNITY THAT OFFERS TERRE HAUTE THE PERFECT BALANCE IN SENIOR LIVING.
IRS990.MissionDesc: WE ARE A VIBRANT NOT-FOR-PROFIT LIFE PLAN COMMUNITY INSPIRING RESIDENTS AND TEAM MEMBERS TO MAXIMIZE THEIR LIVES AND THE LIVES OF OTHERS.
IRS990.Desc: AGREEMENT WITH RUSH MEMORIAL HOSPITAL RELATED TO LEASE, TRANSFER OF OPERATIONS AND MANAGEMENT OF THE ASSISTED LIVING AND INDEPENDENT LIVING LICENSED RESIDENTIAL BEDS AND CERTIFIED HEALTH FACILITY. THE AGREEMENT EFFECTIVELY PROVIDES FOR THE HOSPITAL TO LEASE THE SKILLED NURSING UNIT PROPERTY AND OPERATIONS AND TO ENTER INTO AGREEMENTS FOR THE ORGANIZATION TO PROVIDE MANAGEMENT OF THE OPERATIONS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: ASSISTED-LIVING MAINTAINS 38 ASSISTED-LIVING APARTMENTS, INCLUDES WEEKLY HOUSEKEEPING, THREE DAILY MEALS, MAINTENANCE AS NEEDED, AND ALL UTILITIES, ALLOWS ACCESS TO THE ORGANIZATION'S ACTIVITIES AND AMENITIES, PERSONALIZED ASSISTANCE.AS FOR PERSONALIZED ASSISTANCE RESIDENTS CAN COUNT ON HELP WITH MEDICATION MANAGEMENT, CUING AND REMINDERS AS WELL AS ACTIVITIES OF DAILY LIVING INCLUDING DRESSING, GROOMING AND BATHING. RESIDENTS CAN TAKE PART IN VARIOUS SOCIAL OPPORTUNITIES AND OUTINGS, TOO.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: INDEPENDENT-LIVING MAINTAINS 174 APARTMENTS AND 28 VILLAS, INCLUDES BIWEEKLY HOUSEKEEPING, FLEXIBLE DINING PRIVILEGES, MAINTENANCE AS NEEDED, AND ALL UTILITIES, ALLOWS ACCESS TO THE ORGANIZATION'S ACTIVITIES AND AMENITIES.

OtherLiabilitiesOrgGrp.Desc: LIFE CONTRACT DEPOSITS AND SECURITY DEPOSITS PAYABLE

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION ALSO MAINTAINS RESIDENT TRUST FUNDS ON BEHALF OF CERTAIN RESIDENTS. THE ORGANIZATION IS A FIDUCIARY OF THESE FUNDS WHICH ARE MAINTAINED FOR THE PERSONAL USE OF THOSE RESIDENTS. THE FUNDS ARE EXPENDED AT THE DIRECTION OF THE RESIDENTS.

THE ORGANIZATION ADOPTED THE INCOME TAX STANDARD FOR UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS. THIS STANDARD CLARIFIES THE ACCOUNTING FOR UNCERTAINTY IN INCOME TAXES RECOGNIZED IN AN ORGANIZATION'S FINANCIAL STATEMENTS IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE INCOME TAX STANDARD. THIS STANDARD PRESCRIBES RECOGNITION AND MEASUREMENT OF TAX POSITIONS TAKEN OR EXPECTED TO BE TAKEN ON A TAX RETURN THAT ARE NOT CERTAIN TO BE REALIZED. THE ORGANIZATION DOES NOT CURRENTLY INCLUDE AN INCOME TAX PROVISION IN THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. MANAGEMENT MONITORS THE REPORTING OF UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS, WHICH COULD RESULT IN RECORDING OF AN INCOME TAX PROVISION IN THE FUTURE.
CHANGE IN FAIR VALUE OF INTEREST SWAP 31,512.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE K, PART II, LINE 3 TOTAL PROCEEDS OF ISSUE:
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: AMOUNT INCLUDES INVESTMENT EARNINGS ON BOND PROCEEDS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 1A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS, BY RESOLUTION ADOPTED BY A MAJORITY OF THE ENTIRE BOARD OF DIRECTORS, MAY DESIGNATE THREE DIRECTORS TO CONSTITUTE AN EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE. DURING INTERVALS BETWEEN MEETINGS OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS AND SUBJECT TO SUCH LIMITATIONS AS MAY BE PROVIDED BY LAW, THE ORGANIZATION'S BY-LAWS OR BY RESOLUTION OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS, THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE SHALL HAVE AND MAY EXERCISE ALL THE AUTHORITY OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS IN THE MANAGEMENT OF THE CORPORATION. THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE SHALL MAKE A FULL REPORT OF ALL ACTIONS TO THE NEXT MEETING OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 3
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION HAS ENTERED INTO A MANAGEMENT AGREEMENT WITH LIFE CARE SERVICES, LLC (LCS) THROUGH DECEMBER 2022. THE AGREEMENT INCLUDES THE SUPERVISION OF ALL ASPECTS OF NORMAL OPERATIONS INCLUDING BUDGETING, HIRING OF EMPLOYEES, BILLING, PAYROLL, ACCOUNTING, ACCOUNTS PAYABLE AND OTHER MANAGEMENT RESPONSIBILITIES. THE CONTRACT MAY BE TERMINATED BY EITHER PARTY BY PROVIDING 90 DAYS WRITTEN NOTICE. LCS HAS MANAGED THE ORGANIZATION SINCE 1984. COLLEEN MATTHEWS, EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR, IS PAID BY LCS AND RECEIVED $110,312 OF COMPENSATION FOR THE YEAR. STEVE STILL WAS INTERIM EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR AND RECEIVED COMPENSATION OF $60,416.31 FROM LCS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FORM 990 IS REVIEWED IN DETAIL BY THE ENTIRE BOARD OF DIRECTORS. AFTER ANY QUESTIONS/CHANGES ARE ADDRESSED, THE FINAL DRAFT OF THE FORM 990 IS DISTRIBUTED VIA E-MAIL TO THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS. IT IS THEN FILED ELECTRONICALLY WITH THE IRS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: BOARD MEMBERS ANNUALLY SIGN DOCUMENTATION STATING IF THEY HAVE A CONFLICT OF INTEREST THEY WILL DISCLOSE THAT CONFLICT WITH THE BOARD. UPON DISCLOSURE OF A CONFLICT, THE RELATED BOARD MEMBERS OR OFFICERS SHALL ABSTAIN FROM TAKING PART IN THE DISCUSSION OR VOTING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR IS AN EMPLOYEE OF LIFE CARE SERVICE (LCS), THE INDEPENDENT BOARD NEGOTIATES AND APPROVES THE CONTRACTED SALARY AMOUNT PAID TO LIFE CARE SERVICES FOR THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTORS SERVICES. LCS DOES PERFORM REGULAR NATIONAL SALARY SURVEYS WITH AN INDEPENDENT FIRM. THE DATA IS USED TO SET LCS PAY RANGES, AND IT IS A BASIS FOR ANNUAL INCREASES. THE INFORMATION IS SHARED WITH BOARD UPON HIRE OF A NEW LCS EMPLOYEE TO THE COMMUNITY, AND DURING ANNUAL INCREASES THE BOARD IS ALSO INFORMED OF THE LCS BONUS PLANS, AND ASKED TO GIVE INPUT INTO THE PLAN'S DISCRETIONARY FACTORS. THE BOARD ALSO COMPLETES ANNUAL EVALUATION ON THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR AND ADMINISTRATOR WHICH IS CONSIDERED DURING THE ANNUAL REVIEW PROCESS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION'S CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, FINANCIAL STATEMENTS, AND GOVERNING DOCUMENTS ARE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.
CHANGE IN FAIR VALUE OF INTEREST RATE SWAP 31,512.
PROCESSES HAVE NOT CHANGED FROM THE PRIOR YEAR.
